intro: Neobouteloua lophostachya, commonly known as the desert three-awn, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spiky inflorescences. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and heat. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, which helps reduce water loss. Neobouteloua lophostachya plays a role in stabilizing soils in its native habitat and is sometimes used in restoration projects.
